page.title: 15LEUCHARS RAILWAY STATION
page.content: Leuchars has a very important station for this district because it is the midway point between Dundee and Edinburgh and it is also used by the RAF base and by people going to St Andrews for work, for holidays and for the University. Approximately 400 passengers use the station every day and the busiest periods are 7.00 am to 10.00 am and 4.00 pm to 6.00 pm. 60 trains pass every day and there are 11 people employed on the station. The station has the following facilities:- a 30 space car park, a waiting room, a shop, toilets and a telephone. Interviews with passengers at about 3.00 pm showed that they thought that the service was good and they were mainly using it to visit St Andrews. A regular bus and taxi service links the station to St Andrews.
